title.narrative: Central America Regional (Dominican Republic, El Salvador, Guatemala, and Honduras): Capacity Assessment Consultation for Implementation of the Principles for Responsible Investment in Agriculture and Food Systems (CFS-RAI)

description.narrative: 1. To improve all stakeholders’ understanding of the relevance of the CFS-RAI Principles in the context of their countries; 2. To analyze the basic elements of an enabling environment for the effective implementation of the CFS-RAI Principles; 3. To identify existing capacities and capacity needs to strengthen an enabling environment for the effective implementation of the CFS-RAI Principles in Central America.

The project aimed to facilitate a three-day consultation with governments, civil society and the private sector on the application of the principles of responsible investment in agriculture and food systems in order to identify priority areas for capacity development to inform the United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization's (FAO) Program in support of its member countries.
Twenty-one participants from four countries in the region attended the workshop (Dominican Republic, El Salvador, Guatemala and Honduras).

participating-org.narrative: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)

provider-org.narrative: Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)
Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations (FAO)
